A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The films cinematography is beautiful and the writing continues to demonstrate a higher quality since Disney took the helm.  The film was a little long in the middle\, and scenes like Luke milking a water donkey were probably superfluous.  It will also likely irk the rare fanboy who considers themselves a Star Wars expert\, particularly the way snoke dies.  However\, those same individuals like Jar Jar Binks and probably still have a VHS recording of the 1980s holiday special and actually think it's good... I found snokes death satisfying and true to spirit of the Sith.  \nThe balance of Action and Story was in harmony and I was thoroughly entertained by the latest release\, and already waiting for the next chapter.
